author: Annie Buck

review: I'm a Prime member and have a an old none wireless Sony Bluray player in the bedroom.  I didn't want to hard wire it to the router in another room so we just didn't watch any streaming in the bedroom.  I waited a little to see what the reviews were like before deciding to purchase a FireTv.Arrived within 2 days and honestly, it was easier to install than it was to unwrap everything!  I had an extra HDMI cable at home, that's all the additional accessories needed to set up, everything else is included.  As soon as I entered the wireless acct PW, boom it started working.  It was a pleasure how easy it was.  5 STARS on that!The FireTv is super easy to use and its exactly what we needed.  We aren't big in to games but watch a LOT of movies through streaming.  I find it easy to search, but as others have stated, I like to ADD movies to my watch list from the computer (couple times a week). That way, all the movies I want to watch are right there and I don't have to waste any time searching for anything.CON for me:  I DON'T like that you can't Turn-Off certain features on the FireTV - not even thru Manage your FIRETV that I can tell...maybe someone can hopefully prove me wrong??  Example:  for Prime users the unit is already linked to my Prime Account and ALL my pictures came up. I don't necessarily want ALL the pictures to show up.WTG AMAZON on this 1st Gen FireTv!P.S. - All my Digital / Ultra Violet movies that I own work using the FLIXTER App. - no issues at all...AWESOME!
author: AB

review: This is a great player if you don't want to play your own videos. It has an optical output that most competitors don't have and the processer is above average. They could fix the local streaming issue with an app of a software update but I don't expect that to happen since this is geared to sell you content and not to let you play your own videos. I'll stick with the WDTV streaming media player until someone comes up with something better.
